Important: Our city location coronavirus reports are separate from the country reports seen in the main table on the coronavirus page.

Sometimes it's very hard to find town/city based cases, as governments usually report on a country or regional basis, and not specifying smaller town cases.

About 50% of the city/town data comes from official government sources, and about 50% comes from trusted news article publications submitted by our team or by our users.

Please note that although we try to get as many cases reported on our cities page, we might sometimes miss some cases for certain locations.

If you know any case, please submit a report on the "city" page after you search, with a link to an official news article or government announcement.

Coronavirus globally

There are 8,203,991 cases of coronavirus confirmed in the world, as of Tuesday, 16th of June 2020.

There are 443,617 deaths confirmed in the world, due to the COVID-19 coronavirus.

There are 77,452 active cases of coronavirus in the world.

There are 4,274,433 recoveries from COVID-19 coronavirus in in the world.

Our coronavirus data is provided by Coronavirus API, and our city and regions based cases are supplied by local government publications and submitted by our users in some cases.

Top 15 countries affected: death rate (%)

Considering the total number of cases and total number of deaths per country, as of today, Tuesday, 16th of June 2020

What would happen if 5 MILLION people get infected in each of the top 15 countries?

Below is a statistical prediction on what would happen if 5 million people get the COVID-19 coronavirus, based on the current death-rate of the countries.

  • At the current death rate of 5.41% in Total: there would be 270,500 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 5.80% in North America there would be 290,000 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 8.23% in Europe there would be 411,500 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 5.40% in USA there would be 270,000 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 2.58% in Asia there would be 129,000 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 4.19% in South America there would be 209,500 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 4.94% in Brazil there would be 247,000 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 1.34% in Russia there would be 67,000 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 3.37% in India there would be 168,500 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 14.08% in UK there would be 704,000 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 9.31% in Spain there would be 465,500 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 2.69% in Africa there would be 134,500 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 14.49% in Italy there would be 724,500 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 2.94% in Peru there would be 147,000 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 4.71% in Iran there would be 235,500 deaths
  • At the current death rate of 4.73% in Germany there would be 236,500 deaths

Reported 1 month ago by user

1 confirmed coronavirus cases in Madanapalle

Madanapalle , IN

Madanapalle town in the district registered its first COVID-19 positive case and Chittoor city its second on Thursday. The Chittoor police declared the Lalu Gardens locality of the town as red zone. According to officials, the patient is a resident of Krishna Puram village of neighbouring Gudipala mandal. He visited his business associate in recent days and remained in Chittoor due to the lockdown. It was found that he had been to the Koyambedu Market in Chennai last month. He was shifted to the COVID hospital. The COVID-19 task force officials rushed to the locality and shifted an associate of the patient to a quarantine facility in Chittoor. Last week, an Ambur resident who used to frequent Chittoor to see his wife tested positive to the virus.

VERIFIED SOURCE

Reported 1 month ago by user

1 dead coronavirus cases in Cugir

Cugir , RO

COVID-19 was the first victim in Cugir. It is about a 63-year-old man who also suffered from other ailments. COVID-19 was the first victim in Cugir. It is about a 63-year-old man, who died yesterday, May 7, 2020, at the Municipal Hospital in Blaj. It is the death number 14 registered, since the beginning of the pandemic, in Alba county. He also suffered from other comorbidities: Hypertension and Chronic Viral Hepatitis - Type B.
